edu.vt.middleware.crypt.util
Class CryptReader

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.middleware.crypt.util.CryptReader

public class CryptReader
extends Object

Helper class for performing I/O read operations on cryptographic data.

Version:
$Revision: 578 $
Author:
Middleware Services

readPrivateKey

public static PrivateKey readPrivateKey(File keyFile,
                                        String algorithm)
                                 throws CryptException,
                                        IOException
Reads a DER-encoded private key in PKCS#8 format from a file into a PrivateKey object. SSLeay-format keys may also work in some cases; testing revealed SSLeay-format RSA keys generated by the OpenSSL rsa command are supported.

Parameters:
keyFile - Private key file.
algorithm - Name of encryption algorithm used by key.
Returns:
Private key containing data read from file.
Throws:
CryptException - On key format errors.
IOException - On key read errors.

readPrivateKey

public static PrivateKey readPrivateKey(InputStream keyStream,
                                        String algorithm)
                                 throws CryptException,
                                        IOException
Reads a DER-encoded private key in PKCS#8 format from an input stream into a PrivateKey object. SSLeay-format keys may also work in some cases; testing revealed SSLeay-format RSA keys generated by the OpenSSL rsa command are supported.

Parameters:
keyStream - Input stream containing private key data.
algorithm - Name of encryption algorithm used by key.
Returns:
Private key containing data read from stream.
Throws:
CryptException - On key format errors.
IOException - On key read errors.

readPemPrivateKey

public static PrivateKey readPemPrivateKey(File keyFile,
                                           char[] password)
                                    throws CryptException,
                                           IOException
Reads a PEM-encoded private key from a file into a PrivateKey object. The header of the PEM-encoded file must meet the requirements described in readPemPrivateKey(InputStream, char[]).

Parameters:
keyFile - File containing private key data in PEM format.
password - Password used to encrypt private key; may be null to indicate no encryption.
Returns:
Private key containing data read from file.
Throws:
CryptException - On key format errors.
IOException - On key read errors.

readPemPrivateKey

public static PrivateKey readPemPrivateKey(InputStream keyStream,
                                           char[] password)
                                    throws CryptException,
                                           IOException
Reads a PEM-encoded private key from an input stream into a PrivateKey object. The header of the encoded key MUST contain the cipher algorithm of the key, e.g.: 
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

This is the case for PEM-encoded SSLeay format private keys created by the OpenSSL rsa command, but not for the OpenSSL pkcs8 command.

Parameters:
keyStream - Input stream containing private key data in PEM format.
password - Password used to encrypt private key; may be null to indicate no encryption.
Returns:
Private key containing data read from stream.
Throws:
CryptException - On key format errors.
IOException - On key read errors.

readPublicKey

public static PublicKey readPublicKey(File keyFile,
                                      String algorithm)
                               throws CryptException,
                                      IOException
Reads a DER-encoded X.509 public key from an input stream into a PublicKey object.

Parameters:
keyFile - File containing DER-encoded X.509 public key.
algorithm - Name of encryption algorithm used by key.
Returns:
Public key containing data read from file.
Throws:
CryptException - On key format errors.
IOException - On key read errors.

                                   throws CryptException,
                                          IOException
Reads a PEM or DER-encoded certificate of the default type from a file into a Certificate object.

Parameters:
certFile - Path to certificate file.
Returns:
Certificate containing data read from file.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate format errors.
IOException - On read errors.

readCertificate

public static Certificate readCertificate(File certFile,
                                          String type)
                                   throws CryptException,
                                          IOException
Reads a PEM or DER-encoded certificate of the given type from a file into a Certificate object.

Parameters:
certFile - Path to certificate file.
type - Type of certificate to read, e.g. X.509.
Returns:
Certificate containing data read from file.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate format errors.
IOException - On read errors.

readCertificate

public static Certificate readCertificate(InputStream certStream)
                                   throws CryptException
Reads a PEM or DER-encoded certificate of the default type from an input stream into a Certificate object.

Parameters:
certStream - Input stream with certificate data.
Returns:
Certificate created from data read from stream.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate read or format errors.

readCertificateChain

public static Certificate[] readCertificateChain(File chainFile)
                                          throws CryptException,
                                                 IOException
Reads a certificate chain of the default certificate type from a file containing data in any of the formats supported by readCertificateChain(InputStream, String).

Parameters:
chainFile - Path to certificate chain file.
Returns:
Array of certificates in the order in which they appear in the given file.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate format errors.
IOException - On read errors.

readCertificateChain

public static Certificate[] readCertificateChain(File chainFile,
                                                 String type)
                                          throws CryptException,
                                                 IOException
Reads a certificate chain of the given type from a file containing data in any of the formats supported by readCertificateChain(InputStream, String).

Parameters:
chainFile - Path to certificate chain file.
type - Type of certificate to read, e.g. X.509.
Returns:
Array of certificates in the order in which they appear in the given file.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate format errors.
IOException - On read errors.

readCertificateChain

public static Certificate[] readCertificateChain(InputStream chainStream)
                                          throws CryptException
Reads a certificate chain of the default certificate type from an input stream containing data in any of the formats supported by readCertificateChain(InputStream, String).

Parameters:
chainStream - Stream containing certificate chain data.
Returns:
Array of certificates in the order in which they appear in the given input stream.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate read or format errors.

readCertificateChain

public static Certificate[] readCertificateChain(InputStream chainStream,
                                                 String type)
                                          throws CryptException
Reads a certificate chain of the default certificate type from an input stream containing data in any of the following formats:
  • Sequence of DER-encoded certificates
  • Concatenation of PEM-encoded certificates
  • PKCS#7 certificate chain

Parameters:
chainStream - Stream containing certificate chain data.
type - Type of certificate to read, e.g. X.509.
Returns:
Array of certificates in the order in which they appear in the stream.
Throws:
CryptException - On certificate read or format errors.

readEncodedBytes

public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.DERObject readEncodedBytes(byte[] data,
                                                               boolean discardWrapper)
                                                        throws IOException
Attempts to create a Bouncy Castle DERObject from a byte array representing ASN.1 encoded data.

Parameters:
data - ASN.1 encoded data as byte array.
discardWrapper - In some cases the value of the encoded data may itself be encoded data, where the latter encoded data is desired. Recall ASN.1 data is of the form {TAG, SIZE, DATA}. Set this flag to true to skip the first two bytes, e.g. TAG and SIZE, and treat the remaining bytes as the encoded data.
Returns:
DER object.
Throws:
IOException - On I/O errors.
